intro: Masdevallia munae, commonly known as the Munae Masdevallia, is a rare orchid species native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its intricate, often colorful flowers that feature a unique combination of petals and sepals. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it relies on specific microclimates for survival. Its botanical structure includes a short, slender stem and a single, upright leaf. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
